events.target_title: JPEG: skip bytes during incremental load
Issue with keyboard workspace move on dual screen
Issue with keyboard workspace move on dual screen
Option to reorder clocks
Option to have the country flags for each clock.
Option to have the country flags for each clock.

note.body:
I work with the company having offices in multiple cities. I use `World Clock` by timeanddate.com in my office PC to keep track of time. Having flags helps visually recognizing instantly what I am looking.

![image](/uploads/f6ba09bf20fab07d60eae19178289a66/image.png)

events.target_title: Option to reorder clocks

note.body:
Ok my mistake. I thought cities are ordered in the sequence I added them. I think for now I can take this issue back. 

The reason I wanted this was, there are some cities which are more important for me than the others, so I wanted to keep them first in the order.

events.target_title: Option to have the country flags for each clock.

note.body: Ok. I don't mind closing it then. I do understand the cost of keeping up to date with always changing political maps.

login with usernames including a dot (".") automatically closes session
Disable on-screen keyboard when physical keyboard is available

note.body: With respect, this is something that I should be able to turn off. Permanently. Forever. I dual boot between Windows (because I need it for work) and Linux (because it is my preferred OS). I have been using Linux since Warty Warthog so a few years. I have always gotten annoyed when using Windows because Linux just works. Since using my new machine, it is Linux that really gets my blood boiling. I have been trying to turn this ... keyboard off all day because it hinders my work. It is a nuisance that some people do not want to have to fight with EVERY SINGLE TIME THAT THEY TOUCH THE !@#$%^&*() COMPUTER.

events.target_title: Compile Error: ‘PANGO_ATTR_INSERT_HYPHENS’ undeclared
Super + P shortcut to switch display not working when selecting a single display configuration

note.body:
Can confirm.

Not only does "Join Display" gets activated but also, if you had a non-default display arrangement then the arrangement gets reset as well.

events.target_title: Super + P shortcut to switch display not working when selecting a single display configuration

note.body:
What I did was create a shell script (with `arandr`) for each screen layout I need (in my case 3: monitor-only, tv-only and extended).

Then open the Gnome Control Center and assign each script a keybinding.

events.target_title: Possible memory corruption (use-after-free?) in Gtk.StyleContext.get_property
Bad font rendering with 1.44

note.body:
Another case here. I was about to open a new issue, then just found this one.

I'm also using the DejaVu Sans font, interpreter version 35 with FreeType and full type hinting.

| Pango version | Screenshot |
| ------------- | ---------- |
| v1.43 | ![screenshot-pango-1.43.0](/uploads/7fff594f90fbd7b3d9bd29bb83e942ba/screenshot-pango-1.43.0.png) |
| v1.44 | ![screenshot-pango-1.44.7](/uploads/36fe68ddcea0d190a298538a4f2e6446/screenshot-pango-1.44.7.png) | 

This is just an example, but font spacing is messed up in all GTK+ widgets.

crash sometimes after clicking a field

note.body:
gnome-mines 3.28.0, Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS bionic

I will alias my mines call with one that uses gdb to get the trace. But I don't play that game too much and the crash also happens not so often.

events.target_title: crash sometimes after clicking a field

note.body: But after taking a quick look into the sources here, I can't find any call of `XInitThreads()` which the error message is criticising. But as mentioned [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18647475/threading-problems-with-gtk#18690540) calling `XInitThreads()` before calling `Gtk.init()` may solve this problem.

> but also mouse interaction, and many statements what "people" hate or like without providing references or proof.
For example me. Or those who use extensions to add this functionality to Gnome. Or those who don't use gnome? Haven't you read articles, watched videos where people are criticizing how things work in Gnome? All these years... not a singe one? As an ergonomist I see many issues in your UI as well. Unfortunately you showed that your are deaf to constructive criticism by closing all my topics with issues. That's a good marker showing Gnome 3 is doomed. Hopefully Ubuntu and Red Hat will drop Gnome support and switch to something better as the default ui. I'm done here.
